Controls how GTS and OFS will handle error conditions for activities using this version record. The following values are allowed :
Null (Reject errors / Approve overrides)
GTS

Validation errors will result in the record being rejected, the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with an error code (90) Overrides will be accepted by default, the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with the acceptance code (00).
OFS

Validation errors will result in the record being rejected, the OFS data record will be returned with details of the error message. Overrides will be accepted by default, the overrides will be returned in the populated OFS data record.
1 (Errors on HLD / Approve Overrides)
GTS

Validation errors will place the record on hold, the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with an error code (80). Overrides will be accepted by default the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with the acceptance code (00).
OFS

Validation errors will place the record on hold, the OFS data record will be returned with the error messages. Overrides will be accepted by default, the values approved will be returned in the populated OFS record.
2 (Errors Rejected / Overrides in HLD)
GTS

Validation errors will result in the record being rejected, the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with an error code (90). Overrides will result in the record being placed on hold, the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with an error code (81).
OFS
Validation errors will result in the record being rejected, the OFS data record will be returned with the error messages. Overrides will result in the record being placed on hold.
3 (Errors in HLD / Overrides HLD)
GTS

Validation errors will place the record on hold, the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with an error code (80). Overrides will result in the record being placed on hold, the GTS data record in the output directory will be appended with an error code (81).
OFS

Validation errors will place the record on hold, the OFS data record will be returned with the error messages. Overrides will result in the record being placed on hold, the OFS data record returned will store the override message.
4 (Hold Only)
GTS
This option is not available using GTS. Messages can be written straight to HLD using the GTS.MODE field in GT.SYSTEM.PARAMETER.
OFS
This setting will place all records in HLD status immediately, no further validation or processing will take place.
1 character numeric must be either null (no value), 1 ,2, 3 or 4.

This field is used to define in a multi branch system whether the user can directly access a record in another company, without having to manually exit the application, sign in to the other company and invoke the application.
Multi branch indicates that the MB product is installed, the term Multi Book can also be used.

This product basically allows financial level data to be stored in the same database table for all companies, as opposed to Multi Company where the data is stored in a separate table for each company.

If this field is set to YES then the user can enter access a record in another company to perform a transaction. The user must have access to the other company via the OTH.BOOK.ACCESS or OTH.BOOK.BLOCK fields of their USER record.
The user does not need to have the ability to sing in to the other company.
An SMS check will be applied for the current application and function before the new company is loaded automatically.

An example would be when a customer wishes to close an account in a branch other than their own, in this case the teller would enter the account number, the system would then switch companies and the account can be closed.
If this field is left blank then in a multi branch environment the user will not be allowed to directly access records in other branches, but must be signed in to that company.
Optional input of YES only when the MB product is installed.

The value(s) defined here are used to produce Deal Slips according to the function and whether the user wants to have them produced automatically or when a 'hot key' is used. Deal Slips can be printed to a connected local printer or directed to a Network device. Refer to the REPORT CONTROL section of the Systems Administration User Guide for details of setting up printers.

Deal slips can be linked to a function such as Input, Reversal or Authorisation and specific Deal Slips can be made to relate to those functions. Either an ENQUIRY record or a D.SLIP.FMT record can be entered. If a valid D.SLIP.FMT then the system will provide an enrichment from the record so the user will know thay have the correct record. Alternatively, an ENQUIRY record can be used to provide a Deal Slip, in this case the enrrichment will inform the user that an ENQUIRY record has been selected. The user can drilldown to the related table D.SLIP.FMT to view or select the record to use. The combination of the associated fields is used to define when the Deal Slip can be produced.
To trigger them automatically you need to define:
This will only print the Deal Slip 'TELLER.SLIP.INPUT' when the deal is validated at I(nput) time.
To trigger them via a 'hot key' or the Desktop Deal Slip icon you need
This will only print the Deal Slip 'TELLER.SLIPPUT' at I(nput) time when the 'hot key' is used

Note: ENQUIRY linked Deal Slips are valid for Desktop (GUI) use only. Since the ENQUIRY will be based on either the live or unauthorised file then only data that is available on those files can be accessed, whereas D.SLIP.FMT can utilise the new data being entered on a deal. ENQUIRY deal slips therefore need to be based on the live or unauthorised record depending on when the deal slip is being produced. For example a new deal would probably be based on the unauthorised record whereas a reversal would be based on the live record.
Input to this field must be a valid record in either ENQUIRY or D.SLIP.FMT files.

This field indicates on what type of business day the VERSION can be run.
This is based on the value of the CURRENT.DAY field on the DATES record.
NORMAL the branch is open on an official working day
RESTRICTED the branch is open on an official holiday, e.g. a weekend or public holiday
CLOSED the branch is closed i.e. the holiday table for the branch indicates a non working day, or the day corresponds to a value on the BRNACH.CLOSED field for the company

For example some business activities can only take place on an official working day such as certain clearing transactions, whereas others e.g. closing a customer account can take place if the branch is open.
If this field is left blank then there will be no check as to whether the version can be run.
Optional input
NORMAL indicates the version can only be run on a normal business day, e.g. only on an official working day for the local country
RESTRICTED indicates that the version can be run on a normal or restricted working day e.g. the branch is open
CLOSED indicates that the version can be run at any time

Enables you to define the field name, which is to be subject to an automatic default value. It must be used in conjunction with the fields AUTO.OLD.CONT and AUTO.FIELD.RTN. The definition of the value or sub-value numbers must always be included in this field.
Field names can be entered in the format:
a) Field name (e.g. MNEMONIC for field 1 in the customer file followed by,
b) '-' When you want to define a multivalue field, followed by,
c) Value Number (e.g. RELATION-1 for RELATION in the customer file) when you want to define multivalue fields, followed by,
d) '.' When the User wants to define a subvalue field, followed by,
e) Sub-Number when you want to define a subvalue field.
Alternatively, field names can be entered as field numbers, as follows:
a) Field number (e.g. 1 for MNEMONIC in the CUSTOMER file), followed by,
b) '.' When you want to define a multivalue field, followed by,
c) 'Value number' (e.g. 7.1 for RELATION in the CUSTOMER file) when you want to define multivalue fields, followed by,
d) '.' When you want to define a subvalue field, followed by,
e) 'Sub number' when you want to define a subvalue field.
Field numbers will be translated to field names when entered.
For local reference fields, use the format LOCAL.REF-n.

Allows you to specify an environment variable. The system will use this variable to check against the value specified in REKEY.VALUE. If it matches then the field will be set for “rekey” in the version provided REKEY.INC.EX is set to “INCLUDE”.
The format can be Application>fieldname (e.g USER>COMPANY.CODE) where the application can be USER or COMPANY only.

This field in VERSION.CONTROL record or VERSION.CONTROL SYSTEM record along with a similar field in SYSTEM.OVERRIDE table set to YES will suppress the system override message.
Any messages that have not been flagged in the System Override Message Table will not be suppressed, even when a VERSION or VERSION.CONTROL (including 'SYSTEM') record is set for suppression.

The default for SYS.MSG.SUPPRESS field in both the System Override Message Table and the VERSION/VERSION.CONTROL will be no suppression. A record 'SYSTEM' in VERSION.CONTROL can be used to define criteria (including message suppression) at global system level as opposed to just application level, so will define version defaults for all versions of all applications.
The following routines can be defaulted for all versions of all applications (apart from message suppression) using the VERSION.CONTROL SYSTEM record.
1. INPUT.RTN
2. AUTH.RTN
3. ID.RTN
4. CHECK.REC.RTN
5. AFTER.UNAU.RTN
6. BEFORE.AUTH.RTN
Display or suppression of a system override message will depend on the following flag settings
YES or NO or NULL (Blank)

Drop down list options of TOGGLE, COMBOBOX, VERTICAL.OPTIONS, NODISPLAY or NULL
Populating DISPLAY.TYPE with NULL will have no change on the version field.
TOGGLE will change the field in a button labelled with the field name; the TOGGLE button can display two states only by appearing in white or grey.
The COMBOBOX option displays checkbox fields (only) as comboboxes
The VERTICAL.OPTIONS option displays radio button vertically as opposed to the normal way which is horisontaly.
The NODISPLAY option allow us to decide whether the field should be displayed or not
Only fields with only two states are advised to use this functionality e.g. YES/NO, TRUE FALSE.
Enables the User to define the new automatic default value. Must be used in conjunction with AUT.OLD.CONT (Field 32) and AUT.FLD.NO (Field 31).

A routine (preceded by "@") may be specified instead of actual values. Input in this field must be in accordance with the field definition of the selected Application. Quotes should only be used where the new data actually requires quotes e.g if a new value is required to be YES it should not be input as "YES". It is important to clearly understand the relation between this field and AUT.OLD. CONT. The following examples will clarify their use.
1. When the User wants to create an automatic default at the creation of new record ID's, he should then make the following input in these three fields :
AUT.FLD.NO - Indicates the field number for which you want to create an automatic default. AUT.OLD.CONT - Must remain blank. AUT.NEW.CONT - Enter the value which you want to default automatically.
2. When you want to replace automatically an old content by a new content, you should then make the following input in these three fields :
AUT.FLD. NO - Indicate the field number for which you want to change automatically the old content.
AUT.OLD .CONT - Enter the old content AUT.NEW.CONT - Enter the new content which you want to replace automatically.
3. When you want to run a subroutine which will default a value in a particular field, you should make the following input in these three fields :

AUT.FLD.NO - Indicates the field number for which you want to create a automatic default AUT.OLD.CONT - Must remain blank. AUT.NEW.CONT - Enter the subroutine name which needs to be executed for the the field in AUT.FLD.NO.
Note: If the field AUT.OLD.CONT is specified, only records containing the specified value will be changed when using this Version.
If the field AUT.OLD.CONT is not specified, the content specified in the field AUT.NEW.CONT will be generated when creating a new record with this Version.
a) When a subroutine needs to be executed then the subroutine name should preceed with an @ symbol
b) The subroutine entered should exist in PGM.FILE with PGM.TYPE = 'S'
c) The VERSION ID should exist in field APPR.FOR.SUBR in the PGM.FILE record for the subroutine.
d) The PGM.TYPE for the VERSION record should be one of the following :- 'U', 'H', 'W', 'M', 'S', 'B'
Up to 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input. No default value).
